Her business is located at a strategic area and her primary customers are frequent renters.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase iron sheets for building more rental houses. Her business goal is to provide stone-built houses within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for construction of another house.

loans.name: Nelly María

texts.es:
La señora Nelly María es casada y tiene 42 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de León,  madre de 2 hijos, como madre responsable lucha todos los días arduamente vendiendo atol y arroz en leche ambulante al igual que refrescos naturales.

La señora Nelly comenta que inicio su negocio productos de sus ahorros, posee una experiencia laborar de 7 años en el negocio, debido a la creciente demanda en el mercado ha buscado el apoyo de ceprodel por medio del financiamiento el cual le ha servido de mucha utilidad para poder aumentar su inventario, el capital de trabajo y así poder mejor la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

La señora Nelly María utilizará el crédito solicitado para la compra de Azúcar, Arroz, Leña, Leche, Canela, etc. La señora Nelly María está sumamente agradecida con Ceprodel por el apoyo y la ayuda que le han brindado en los momentos más difíciles ya que este le será una gran bendición para su desarrollo y el de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly María is 42, and married. She is from the city of Leon.  As the mother of two children, and as a responsible parent, she works hard every day as a street vendor, selling atol (a corn-based hot drink), rice in milk, as well as natural drinks.

Nelly says that she started her business by buying products with her savings. She has seven years experience working in the business. Due to the growing market demand, she sought the support of Ceprodel through a loan; and this has proven very useful to her, by allowing her to increase both her inventory and working capital, and in this way improve her children's quality of life.

Nelly Maria will use the loan applied for to buy sugar, rice, firewood, milk, cinnamon, etc. Nelly Maria  is extremely grateful to Ceprodel for the support and help they have provided her during the most difficult times. This loan will be a great blessing for her, for her own development and that of her whole family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, firewood, milk, and cinnamon.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorenzo Timoteo

texts.es:
Lorenzo vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente..  En su tiempo libre disfruta de escuchar música;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Lorenzo le gusta mucho es el Tallarin Rojo.	
			
Lorenzo trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta  20 clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable cuando conduce su mototaxi y los clientes se sienten seguros cuando utilizan sus servicios.

Lorenzo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva puedan ya que con el apoyo brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y arreglar las puertas del mismo, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo en buen estado para así brindar más seguridad y así poder seguir luchando cumplir su gran sueño: tener una panadería."
texts.en:
Lorenzo lives in Ica, Peru.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, around four hours to the south of Lima, the country's capital.  It is called "La Tierra del Sol" (Land of the Sun) by Peruvians.  It is well known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (a 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011) and its production of grapes, asparagus and olives.  Perhaps, above all, it is best known as being home to Peru's traditional drink 'Pisco'.  This warm and dry climate is home to our client's house and business.  In his free time, Lorenzo enjoys listening to music.  It is well known that Peru is noted for having the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Lorenzo most enjoys is 'tallarin rojo'.

Lorenzo works as a motorcycle taxi driver.  He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 20 customers a day.  He believes that his business is doing well because he is very responsible when he drives his motorcycle taxi and his customers feel safe when they use his services.

Lorenzo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their support, he will be able to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle and fix its doors.  This will allow him to have a vehicle which in a good state of repair and he will be able to provide his customers with greater safety.  This will enable him to continue working hard towards fulfilling his biggest dream which is "to own a bakery".

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and to fix its doors

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi cooks kenkey for sale at Eguafo, near Elmina.  She is married to a farmer and has 5 children.   Esi  has been selling kenkey for 15  years now.  She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey for sale

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 49-year-old lady from Homabay County in western Kenya. She is married to Paul and they have six children aged between 13 and 27 years.

Pamela operates a farming business, planting tomatoes and other crops. She has been doing this for the last eleven years. She makes a monthly income of KES 5,800 and is now taking a first KADET LTD loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer for the tomato farm. She will use her profits to pay the loan and also school fees for her children.

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the tomato farm.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 2 to 4 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

Salome operates a restaurant where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area conducive for business and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of housing. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more ingredients for making food. Her business goal is to run a similar restaurant in the nearby town within five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Mariita

texts.en:
Mariita is a 28-year-old business man in Shanzu, Mombasa. He is married. He runs a welding workshop, a business he has been operating for the past three years. His business is doing great.

This marks his second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase metal bars. He expects to get profits from his business, which he will use to expand his shop further. 

He hopes to have a bigger welding shop.

loans.use: to purchase metal bars.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a farmer in her town of Kitale, where she lives with her family of six children, who are still in school.  She runs a hotel business but says the farming business still stands out as the best business for her, owing to gains made .

Florence has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She says this will help her meet the family's basic requirements and improve the status of her hotel business.  She intends to expand her poultry business and possibly double the business in five years.  Her challenges are poor road networks and prices within the local market, due to the large number of farmers taking their supplies to the local market. She is glad Juhudi Kilimo provides farmers with the farming loans.

loans.use: To buy poultry chicks

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single mother of one child, age 12.  She has been in farming for two years and says these years have been her greatest years since she embarked on farming and providing her family with all the basic needs from her farming business.  Her farm produces milk and pineapples.

Caroline has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.  She says the income generated will help in providing basic family needs and, more specifically, educating her child.  She adds that she has hopes the business will grow and enable her to establish a cereals wholesale business in the area. 
 
She says pineapple is doing well in the area but laments a lack of better market prices.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 25 year-old lady from Homabay, Western Kenya, and is married to Manasse.  They have 2 kids, ages 3 and 5 years. 

Nancy has operated a clothes and traveling bags business for the last five years, making a monthly income of KES. 3,600.  She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, with which she will buy a stock of clothing and traveling bags. She will use her profits to expand her clothing stock.  Her dream is to have a better future life.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothing and travelling bags.

loans.name: Ife Olouwa 1 Group

texts.fr: IFE OLOUWA 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres mènent leurs activités dans le même lieu et ont des liens de parenté. La représentante du groupe, Hounssi Mègbè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 57 ans. Hounssi Mègbè est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Hounssi Mègbè n’a pas été à l’école. Hounssi Mègbè vit ensemble avec ses deux enfants à charge et assure leurs différents besoins, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Hounssi Mègbè prépare en effet de la nourriture (riz, haricot), qu’elle vend dans une ville du Bénin depuis une trentaine d’année. De façon secondaire, Hounssi Mègbè  vend des divers (biscuits, etc.). Hounssi Mègbè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Hounssi Mègbè sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFE OLOUWA 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The Ife Oulowa 1 group is composed of three people who are related to each other and work in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Hounssi Mègbè (raising her hand in the photo) is 57 years old. Hounssi Mègbè is a widow and the mother of four children, two of whom are still in her care. Hounssi Mègbè did not go to school. She lives together with her two dependent children and supports them thanks to her business revenues. Hounssi Mègbè prepares food for sale (such as rice and beans). She has been selling food in a town of Benin for about 30 years. As a secondary activity, she sells miscellaneous items (cookies, etc). Hounssi Mègbè stocks up at a market in Benin.  With the goal of meeting customer demand and   expanding her activities, she is seeking a second loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of her group. This loan will allow the group members better meet customer needs and increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and sauce condiments.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Tété Jeannette. Les membres du groupe se connaissent compte tenu du fait qu’ils habitent le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Agée de 44 ans, Tété Jeannette est mariée à un bijoutier du nom de Thomas. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Pour y arriver, Tété Jeannette  vend depuis une quinzaine d’année, des poissons, et parallèlement, des condiments et des bois de chauffage dans une ville du Bénin. Tété Jeannette achète ses produits au Bénin. La clientèle de Tété Jeannette devient de plus en plus nombreuse, et pour satisfaire toute la demande de sa clientèle et se faire plus de profits, Tété Jeannette sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Tété Jeannette et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité par l’augmentation du stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Dieu Est Grand ["God is great"] is a group made up of three women, whose representative (the woman raising her hand in the photo) is named Tété Jeannette. The members of the group know one another from living in the same neighborhood. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking a credit from Alidé.

44 years old, Tété Jeannette is married to a jeweler named Thomas. The couple has four children in their care, three of whom are their own children. Some of the children attend school. The couple sees to the various expenses together. In order to do so, Tété Jeannette has been selling fish for fifteen years, along with spices and firewood in a town in Benin. Tété Jeannette purchases her wares in Benin. Her customers are becoming more and more numerous and in order to meet customer demand and make more of a profit, Tété Jeannette, along with the other members of the Dieu Est Grand Group, is seeking a fourth credit from Alidé. This loan will certainly allow Tété Jeannette and her group to grow their business by increasing the stock of their goods and expanding their customer base and their income.

loans.use: To purchase crates of fish.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is aged 50 and has been in the farming business in her rural home of Kitale for six years. Her farm produces milk, maize, beans, and eggs, which are all sold within the local market. She runs a taxi business besides farming.

Lucy has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow. This is her third loan with Juhudi Kilimo after the first and second ones of 31,200 KES and 50,000 KES respectively. She appreciates that these loans have changed the living standards of her family.

She sees the shortage of dairy cow feed as her major challenge.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has 2 children, whose ages range from 2 to 6 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail shop where he sells home products. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in and area conducive to good sales and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation when delivering to customers. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more home products for selling. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Fanny Cecilia

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fanny, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de 19, 15, 9, 8 y 5 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y los menores escuela. El marido es mecánico automotriz.
p>
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja casi todos los días de la semana de dos a tres horas diarias más que todo en las tardes, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que  son muy buenos.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer y sus compañeras son muy cumplidas. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the "Esfuerzo y Poder" communal bank meet every two weeks in Olmedo canton, in Manabi province. This place is known for its beautiful scenery and hard-working people who make their living farming and raising livestock. 

This is where we met Fanny. She is 33, married, and has five children, ages 19, 15, 9, 8, and 5. The two eldest are in high school, and the younger ones are in primary school. Her husband is an auto mechanic. 

She is a housewife, and to earn her own income and help her husband withe household expenses, she sells Yanba products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories). 

She works every day of the week for two to three hours a day, especially in the afternoons. She sells on credit and collects weekly. She has been working in this business for four years, and it is going very well. What she sells the most of is perfume and cosmetics, as they are very good. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear. This is her fifth cycle in the communal bank and she is the payment treasurer. She likes it because the payments are easy to make, and her co-members are very punctual. Her dream is to keep her business going, and do her best for her children.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 40 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged 20, 13 and 9 years respectively. She operates a fish-selling business which she started 15 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase a variety of fish for sale.  She will use the profits to repay her loan. Her hope is to improve her standard of living. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fish for sale

loans.name: Futuro Para El Bien Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa es viuda tiene 57 años y 06 hijos,  motivo por el cual  trabaja mucho.  Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas  al paso, empezó vendiendo anticuchos en la puerta de su casa, tiempo después una amiga le vendió un carrito sanguchero así su negocio fue creciendo permitiéndole ofrecer variedad a sus clientes como salchipapas, pollo broster, anticuchos y hamburguesas. Sus comensales son en su mayoría trabajadores de la zona sobretodo cobradores y choferes de una línea de transportes, para la Sra. Teresa Su trabajo es primordial porque es el sustento de su hogar,  por eso quiere seguir progresando  su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio para eso quiere utilizar una parte de su casa donde pueda tener un ambiente adecuado con  sillas y mesas para atender con comodidad, su actual préstamo lo usara para comprar los insumos que utiliza como aceite, especias y sobretodo carbón al por mayor. En la actualidad la Sra. Teresa es presidenta del grupo “FUTURO PARA EL BIEN”  la mayoría vecinas del mismo lugar.

 La Sra.Teresa es la 5ta de la derecha viste chaleco azul
texts.en:
Teresa is 57, and a widow. She has six children, so she works hard. She sells fast food. She began selling anticuchos (beef heart marinated, skewered, and seared over the grill), at the door of her house, after a friend sold her a food cart. In this way, her business gradually grew, allowing her to offer her customers variety, such as salchipapas (fried sausage and potato), fried chicken, anticuchos and hamburgers. 

Her diners are mostly workers in the area, especially fare collectors and drivers that work for a bus company. For Teresa, her work is essential, because it is how she supports her household. That is why she wants to keep moving forward. 

Her greatest wish is to expand her business. To do that, she wants to use part of her house where she can have a suitable area with chairs and tables, so that she can serve conveniently.

She will use her current loan to buy the ingredients and supplies she uses, such as cooking oil, spices, and especially charcoal bought at wholesale. Teresa is currently president of the “Futuro para el Bien" group, who are mostly neighbors from the same place.

Teresa is the fourth person from the right, wearing a blue vest.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and charcoal at wholesale.

loans.name: Miriam Janeth

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 25 años, se describe como una persona tranquila, timida y responsable en las labores que realiza. Miriam vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en Latacunga en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Miriam trabaja en la crianza de animales como conejos, cuyes entre otros. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de un conejo de raza fina para poder cruzar con sus conejas, también va a comprar alimento para sus conejos debido a que se viene temporada de ferias y quiere engordarlos para su venta. Esta inversión ayudará a Miriam a obtener buenos ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.

Miriam sueña con construir un lugar donde pueda criar de mejor manera a sus animales.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 25 year old woman. She describes herself as a person who is quiet, timid and responsible as she goes about her work. She lives with her husband and two children in Latacunga in Cotopaxi Province.

Miriam raises animals such as rabbits and guinea pigs, among others. This is her first loan from Fodemi and she will invest it in the purchase of pure-bred rabbits so she can cross breed them with her rabbits. She is also going to buy feed for her rabbits because the festival season is coming and she wants to fatten them to sell. This investment will help Miriam earn a good income and she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Miriam dreams of building a place where she will be able to raise her animals in a better way..

loans.use: to buy pure-bred rabbits in order to improve the stock she has and to buy alfalfa to feed her rabbits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Amadou Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Amadou Mamadou est éleveur de bœufs depuis plus de six ans .Il habite dans une zone ou cette activité est très bien connu et exercée par la plupart des habitants. Il est marié et père de famille. Cette activité lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
Avec le crédit, il va acheter  des bœufs  au moins  trois à quatre  pour  augmenter un peu  la quantité de son troupeau ce qui lui permet de satisfaire sans rupture sa clientèle. Il est à son premier crédit  et il compte beaucoup sur la caisse pour aller de l’avant.
texts.en:
Amadou Mamadou has been raising cattle for six years.  He lives in a zone where this business is well known and practiced by the majority of locals.  He is both a husband and a father.  This business enables him to improve the living conditions of his children. 

With this loan, he will purchase at least 3 or 4 cattle in order to slightly grow the size of his flock, thereby allowing him to satisfy his clientele without interruption.  This is his first loan, and he is counting firmly on the lending partner to help him move forward.

loans.use: to purchase and raise cattle for resale.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José hombre trabajador, humilde, casado, su mayor proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y mejora su nivel de vida. Trabaja para una miscelánea desde hace tiempo como guardia de seguridad. Con el préstamo anterior construyo el baño obteniendo grandes beneficio a su familia, eliminando las posibilidades de enfermedades. Con este nuevo préstamo compra materiales de construcción como: piedras canteras, hierro, piedrín, arena, cemento, clavos, alambre, tablones, estribu, laminas de zinc entre otros materiales para la construcción de un cuarto, ya que a la actualidad está formado por láminas de zinc en malas condiciones. Siendo de gran peligro por el nivel de delincuencia que existe en la zona que habita. 
Agradecido con la financiera por el apoyo por poder continuar con sus proyectos. Así también poder obtener protección y comodidad.
texts.en:
Jose is a married man who is hardworking and humble. His biggest project is to improve his home’s infrastructure and improve his standard of living. He has been working as a security guard for a small store for some time. With a previous loan he built a bathroom, which greatly benefitted his family by eliminating the possibility of disease.

With this new loan, Jose will buy construction materials such as quarry stone, iron, gravel, sand, cement, nails, wire, boards, buttresses and zinc sheeting among other items to build a room since currently the room consist only of zinc sheeting in bad condition. This is dangerous because of the level of crime existing in his neighborhood.

He is grateful to the lender for the support so he can continue with his projects which enable him to obtain protection and comfort. .

loans.use: to buy materials to build a room for his house.

loans.name: Cruz Santa

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Cruz, tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera pero  hace varios años  tuvo una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen 4 hijos todos ellos  mayores de edad, la menor tiene 20 años y estudian en Universidad y es la que aun vive con ella.
 
La señora Cruz para salir adelante se dedica al comercio, todos los días ella instala un pequeño local en una de las vías del cantón donde les permiten a los comerciantes vender sus productos, allí vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, zapatillas y otros productos, los fines de semana que es cuando más gente llega a la ciudad y hay mas ventas y ella requiere de la ayuda para lo cual contrata a una persona a quien  le paga un sueldo. Lleva más de 20 años en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien. Ella viaja hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar mercadería cada vez que necesita.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos para surtir aun más su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy confiables y unidas.
 
Su sueño es tener un local bien establecido.
texts.en:
In Olmedo canton in Manabi province, the communal bank "Esfuerzo y Poder" meets every 15 days.  This is a place that is known for its beautiful countryside and for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Here we meet Cruz, aged 58, who is a single mother, but who was once in a common-law marriage that produced 4 children who are now all adults.  The youngest, aged 20, still lives with her and attends the university.

In order to get ahead, Cruz works in retail trade.  Every day, she sets up a small stand in one of the streets of the canton where they allow merchants to sell their products.  There she sells all types of clothing, shoes, sneakers and other products.  The weekends are when the most people come to the city and when she makes the most sales, so on these days she needs extra help and employs someone who she pays a wage.  She has been in this business for more than 20 years, and the business has gone very well for her.  Thanks to this business, she has been able to support her children so that they could become good people.  Cruz travels to the city of Guayaquil to buy merchandise whenever she needs it.

Cruz will use this loan to buy clothing and shoes to stock up her business with more products.  She is the founding member of her communal bank, and she likes it because her fellow members are very reliable and united.

Her dream is to have a well-established store.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Dodokpo Group

texts.fr: DODOKPO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres se connaissent de par leurs activités. Le représentant du groupe, Ayodélé Laurent (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 41 ans. Ayodélé Laurent est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Colette. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ayodélé Laurent vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Ayodélé  Laurent a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et a appris ensuite la soudure. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Ayodélé Laurent exerce depuis seize ans dans sa région, la soudure, activité qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. De façon secondaire, Ayodélé Laurent vend des bouteilles de gaz. Ayodélé Laurent s’approvisionne dans des villes du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Ayodélé Laurent sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DODOKPO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Dodokpo is a group of three people who have come together through their businesses.  The representative of the business, Ayodélé Laurent (with his hand raised in the photo) is 41 years old.  Ayodélé Laurent is married to a retailer named Colette.  The couple has six children together, all of whom are in school and dependents.  Ayodélé Laurent lives together with his wife and children.  The couple works together to meet the various ends of the household.

Ayodélé Laurent stopped attending school at the primary level, and started to learn how to weld.  In order to face his various responsibilities, Ayodélé Laurent has been working for ten years in the region as a welder, a trade that has earned him significant profits.  Secondarily, Ayodélé Laurent sells gas canisters.  Ayodélé Laurent stocks up in the towns of Bénin.

In the pursuit of satisfying his clientele and in order to expand his business, Ayodélé Laurent is seeking his second loan through ALIDé along with the other members of the Dodokpo Group.  This loan will enable them to better respond to the demands of their clientele and to consequently earn higher profits.  The first loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal for welding and gas canisters.

loans.name: Marisella Raquel

texts.es:
La joven Marisella labora como docente de primaria, ella es una mujer emprendedora que ama su trabajo ya que encante trabajar con niños campesinos de su comunidad, según referencias es una joven con muchos deseos de superacion profesional y laboral lo ha demostrado en su centro de trabajo, ademas es muy querida por sus alumnos, compañeros de trabajo y padres de familia.                                                                                                       

Solicita su 2do crèdito para construir dos paredes en la casa de sus padres, que es con quienes vive, ademas expresa que sus padres le dieron cuanto ellos pudieron cuando ella estaba pequeña y ahora es tiempo que apoye a su familia que tanto lo necesita. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que familia permanezca bien unida y seguir estudiando para ser una docente profesional.
texts.en:
The young woman Marisella works as a primary teacher. She is an enterprising woman who loves her work since she loves working with the rural children of her community. According to her references, she is a young woman with a great desire for excellence, professionally and at work, which she has demonstrated at her work place. Furthermore, she is much loved by her students, her co-workers, and parents.

She is applying for her second loan to construct two walls in her parents' house, with whom she lives. In addition, she comments that her parents gave her what they could when she was little, and now it is time that she helps her family, which so much needs it.

Her greatest dream in life is that her family remain well united and that she can continue studying to be a professional teacher.

loans.use: to put up two walls

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 44 años de edad, está casado con Pelayo de 45 y de aquella relación tienen 6 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia que esta ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Juana es una madre sacrificada que día a día trabaja por el bienestar de sus pequeños, pues cultiva cacao y café en su parcela que está ubicada a 30 minutos de su casa. Asimismo nos comenta que ya tiene más de 25 años dedicándose a esta labor conjuntamente con su esposo, pues gracias ellos han logrado comprarse una vivienda en la provincia de Huanta y varios terrenos agrícolas. Por tal motivo está contenta, sin embargo el trasladar sus productos hacia los lugares de acopio le resulta difícil ya que no cuenta con acceso para vehiculo, por ello está pensando abrir un restaurante por que vio una gran oportunidad para este tipo de negocio. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles realizará la compra de muebles para su restaurante.
texts.en: Juana is 44 years old. She is married to Pelayo, who is 45, and together they have 6 children. They live together in their own house, which is located in the community of Periavente Alta, in the district of Llochegua. Juana is a sacrificing mother who works day after day for the well-being of her children, since she grows cacao and coffee on her parcel of land, which is located 30 minutes from her house. She also comments that she has been doing this work for 25 years with her husband, and thanks to it, they have succeeded in buying a house in the province of Huanta and several agricultural plots. For that reason she is happy; nevertheless, the transport of their products to the collection centers can be difficult, since they don't have access to a vehicle. For this reason, she is thinking about opening a restaurant, because she saw a great opportunity for this type of business. This will be her second loan with MFP, and so she promises to make her payments. With the 2500 PEN, she will purchase furniture for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy furniture to set up a restaurant

loans.name: Linlingnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement LINLINGNON est composé de vingt huit personnes qui exercent ensemble leurs activités de transformation. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Etiennette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Etiennette est âgée de 54 ans et est une veuve. Etiennette est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. En plus de ses quatre enfants, Etiennette a un autre enfant à charge. Etiennette vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Etiennette. Pour y parvenir, Etiennette mène comme activité, la transformation du manioc et des noix de palme qu’elle vend dans sa région au Bénin. Etiennette s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Etiennette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement LINLINGNON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Linlingnon group consists of 28 people who are involved in processing activities together.  This is the second time that the group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to increase their level of activity.  The facilitator of the group, named Etiennette, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  Etiennette is 54 years old and a widow.  She is the mother of 4 children, who all go to school and are all her dependents.  Besides her four children, Etiennette has another child in her care.  She lives alone with her children and takes care of the various household expenses.  In order to provide for her family, she processes cassava and palm nuts and sells them locally in Benin.  She buys her products in one of the regions of Benin.  In order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income, she and the other members of the Linlingnon group, are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  Their first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava and palm nuts.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Alejandro  le gusta mucho es el “Arroz Chaufa”, Alejandro estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesor. El es padre de un pequeño de 5 años, el cual cursa educación inicial.	
		
Alejandro trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, se dedica a este trabajo 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 60 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda un buen a los clientes y sobre todo es honrado en su trabajo.

Alejandro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado el podrá comprar llantas de repuesto para su vehículo, con ello le permitirá tener los  repuestos necesarios de presentarse algún inconveniente y así poder seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:”Tener su casa propia."
texts.en:
Alejandro lives in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country and is acclaimed by Peruvians as “The Land of the Sun.” It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (a 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus and olives and perhaps above all as the source of the traditional Peruvian drink, Pisco.

We find the client’s house and business in this hot, arid climate. As is well known Peru is characterized as having the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Alejandro enjoys a great deal is “Arroz Chaufa”. He studied until the fifth year of secondary school and he would have liked to study to be a teacher. He is the father of a 5 year old boy who is just beginning school.

Alejandro works as a motor taxi driver. He works 12 hours a day and has about 60 customers a day. He believes that his business is doing well because he provides good service and above all he is honest in his dealings.

Alejandro is very grateful for Kiva loans since thanks to the support he has received he will be able to buy spare tires for his vehicle. The loan will also enable him to make necessary repairs even though it is a bit inconvenient. Thus he will be able to continue fighting to realize his great dream: “Having his own home.”

loans.use: to buy spare tires.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase various goods and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow and poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a gas cooker and kitchenware

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is married to a farmer and has seven dependents. She cooks and sells kenkey, a fermented maize dough commonly eaten in Ghana. She uses her income to contribute to meeting the family’s needs.

In the photo is Georgina with the maize she uses to make kenkey. She needs this 300 GHS loan from CRAN to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. Georgina will use her greater profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Coycillia

texts.en:
Coycillia is a 32-year-old from Homabay County, West of Kenya.  She is married to John and they have two children, aged 10 and 4 years.  They are also supporting a 13-year-old orphaned girl.

Coycillia operates a cosmetics shop and has been doing this for the last three years.  She is able to make a monthly income of KES 8,100.  She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy perfumes, lotions and hair braids. She will use her profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: buy perfumes, lotions and hair braids

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy shoes

loans.name: Kipngeno

texts.en:
Kipngeno is a father of one child, aged 2 years.  He has been in farming for 6 years.  He is a teacher by profession but says the farming income has been of great help in providing for his family needs.  His farm products of milk and vegetables are sold locally.

Kipngeno has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.  He is focusing on growing both layers and broilers on his farm.  He adds that the income will help him meet his family's basic needs and build a strong foundation for his young family.

He says the challenge in farming remains poor roads network which curtails smooth deliveries of fresh produce to the markets.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a mother of ten children, all are of school-going age. She has been in farming for 34 years and sells her produce, which includes vegetables, beans and maize, at the local market.  She says her family fully relies on farming for their daily upkeep needs.

Florence has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 41,600 KES. She will use the money to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She adds that the milk will supplement her family daily meals and provide income to give financial security to the family.

She laments about the high costs of management of diseases and feeds, especially during the dry seasons.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: service his motorcycle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 59, is a resident of Litein in the South Rift Valley of Kenya. He is married with three adult children and one who is still in school. He has been a farmer for 29 years and says farming has been the source of his family’s livelihood all these years. He currently employs two farmhands and supplies the local market mainly with tea and milk. Poor prices for milk in the local market and livestock diseases remain his major challenges.

Joseph has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says he wants a better grade cow than the ones he has been keeping so as to increase his dairy's milk production. He believes he will be able to see his last-born child through school with his farming income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mihin Ayi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIHIN AYI est composé de trois personnes qui pratiquent leurs activités dans le même marché. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Chéri est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Chéri est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Chéri n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Chéri est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Jean. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Chéri vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Chéri vend des poissons et de l’huile de palme qu'elle produit dans une région du Bénin. Chéri s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Chéri sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIHIN AYI, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MIHIN AYI is comprised of three persons who operate their businesses in the same market. The group's representative, Chéri, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 33 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. Chéri is married to a furniture maker by the name of Jean. They have five children, all in school and in their care. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered.

To ensure the diverse family expenses are covered, Chéri sells fish and palm oil, which she produces in a region in Benin. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and her revenues, Chéri along with the other members of the group MIHIN AYI are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts (to make palm oil) and some fresh fish

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a 47-year-old married mother of five children, ages between 17 and 29. Her spouse is a primary school teacher.  Dinah owns a food store  whereby she sells dry maize.  She has been in operation for a period of seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 17,000.

Dinah has applied for a loan of KES 50,000.  This is her fifth loan and she wishes to use this amount to purchase 40 bags of dry maize from local suppliers for resale.  The anticipated profit from the business will be used to plough back into the business.

Dinah hopes to prosper in her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon is 23 years old and single.  He has been in dairy farming since his teenage-hood.  He lives in with his parents in their rural home in Litein, South Rift Kenya.

Weldon has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutter at 30,000 KES and build a zero-grazing unit at 30,000 KES.  He says the zero grazing unit will help manage the feeding challenge which is always experienced during the dry seasons. He adds that he expects improvement in milk production due to better feeding of the animals with the use of a chaff cutter to make their feeds.  He plans to buy more parcels of land to expand his farm in the future.

Weldon adds that ownership of land is the major challenge for him, since limited land curtails large-scale farming.

loans.use: construct a zero-grazing unit and buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a chaff cutter and poultry birds

loans.name: Andryi

texts.ru:
Андрей живет в Хустском районе, Западная Украина. Он состоит в разводе с женой, у него есть ребенок. Андрей арендует склад, переоборудованный под кузницу, изготавливает эксклюзивные кованные изделия, а именно перила, ворота, мебель, разные подставки. Андрей – очень талантливый мастер. Все изделия он делает не по шаблону, но к каждому заказу подходит индивидуально. У Андрея нет конкурентов. Товар пользуется спросом, есть своя клиентская база. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 6 лет. Чистая прибыль составляет немногим больше 6 000 гривен ежемесячно. 

Кредит в размере 10 000 гривен необходим Андрею для того, чтобы приобрести металлические заготовки и дополнительное оборудование (тиски) для кузницы. Клиенты Андрея знают, что каждую вещь он изготавливает очень старательно и неповторимо, никогда не клонирует изделия, поэтому качество работы Андрея очень ценят все, кто хоть раз к нему обращался. Андрей предан своему делу. Он вкладывает в него много сил и времени и планирует и в дальнейшем развивать свой бизнес и расширяться по мере возможности. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Andryi lives in the Khoost District of western Ukraine.   He has a son and is divorced.  Andryi rents a warehouse that has been re-equipped as a blacksmith shop where he produces exclusive forged products, namely handrails, gates, furniture, and various pedestals and stands.  Andryi is a talented craftsman.  None of his products are based on patterns, instead he approaches each order individually.  Andryi has no competition. His products enjoy strong demand and he has his own client base.  He has been in this business for 6 years.  His net profit is a little more than 6,000 hryven (UAH) per month.  

A loan of 10,000 hryven is necessary for Andryi to buy bar stock and additional equipment (a vise) for his blacksmith shop.  Andryi's clients know that each item he produces is painstakingly made and unique, nothing is cloned.  Because of this, everyone who has dealt with him even once greatly appreciates the quality of his work.  Andryi is devoted to his work.  He invests in it a great deal of energy and time, and he plans to develop his business and to expand it as much as possible.

Note: story in Russian.

loans.use: to buy bar stock and additional equipment (a vise) for his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Kasul

texts.en:
Kasul, 35, lives in Juba, South Sudan. He is married and has five children between the ages of two and nine years, four of whom go to school.

Kasul has been selling roofing poles for the past six years. He has one employee. Presently, Kasul’s major challenge is the low cost of housing construction versus the high cost of construction materials in Juba. Aside from this business, he has no other source of income.

Kasul heard about Finance Sudan through the office’s market outreach and promotion. He is taking a loan of 3500 SDG to purchase more roofing poles to sell. In five years time Kasul would like to realize growth in his business and to have better houses to rent as well.

Kasul wishes to thank those who financially support South Sudan. He hopes Finance Sudan will continue with its program.

loans.use: to purchase more roofing poles to sell.

loans.name: Los Alamos (Charapoto) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto Provincia de Manabí se reúne cada quince días los 2 socios y las 19 socias del Banco Comunal los Álamos. Los mismos que se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y a la cría de animales. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Yexi, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 9 y 5 años de edad, los tres mayores  estudian uno en colegio y dos en escuela. El marido es agricultor.
 
Ella como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para junto con su esposo utilizarlo en la agricultura, en temporadas de invierno ellos siembran maíz, maní y ciertas legumbres y ya para el verano su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de carbón el cual lo sale a vender a ciertos restaurantes y asaderos de pollos donde consumen mucho este material para cocinar los alimentos. En la actualidad quieren el crédito para comprar insecticidas y fertilizantes para tener una buena producción agrícola, requieren de mucha urgencia los insecticidas porque sus cultivos tienen mucha plaga y se están dañando.

Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes e insecticidas. Lleva 4 ciclos en el banco comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta por la ayuda que les han dado con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son comprar un carro y tener su casa con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
The two men and nineteen women members of Los Álamos Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the city of Charapoto, province of Manabí.  Most of them work in agriculture and raising animals.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.
 
One of the members of this group is Yexi.  She is 34 years old and is in a common-law union from which she has four children, ages 12, 10, 9, and 5.  The three older children study, one in high school and two in elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Like the good wife that she is, she is getting the loan to use it with her husband in agriculture.  During the winter season they grow corn, peanuts, and certain vegetables, and then in the summer her husband works buying and selling charcoal, which he goes out to sell to certain restaurants and roast chicken places where they use this material a lot to cook the food.

Currently they want the loan to buy insecticide and fertilizer to have a good farm crop.  They need  the insecticides urgently because their crops have lots of pests and they are being harmed.

This loan is to buy fertilizer and insecticide.  She has been with the communal bank for four cycles.  She is the president of the bank and she likes it because they have given her the loans.

Her dreams are to buy a car and to have her house with all the basic services.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Daysi Janeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 

Aquí conocimos a la señora Daysi, tiene 52 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una  hija de 16 años que estudian en colegio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son  muy unidas y confiables.

Ella tiene un almacene  el centro del cantón en el cual vende de todo un poco, en su local sus clientes encuentran electrodomésticos, platos, colchones, bisutería, ropa, pañales entre otros muchos productos, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, en ciertas ocasiones su hija le ayuda en su trabajo cuando está desocupada.  Lleva más de 15 años con su local y  gracias a este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su hija.

Este crédito es para surtir su negocio comprar bisutería, electrodomésticos, ropa, entre otros productos. 

Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Esfuerzo y Poder Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Olmedo Canton in the province of Manabí.  This place is known for its pretty landscapes and the hardworking people who work in agriculture and raising animals.

This is where we met Daysi.  She is 52 years old and the single mother of a 16-year-old daughter who studies in high school.  She is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the president of the group and she likes it because her companions are very close and dependable.

She has a department store in the center of the canton where she sells a little of everything.  In her place her customers find household appliances, plates, cushions, costume jewelry, clothing, and diapers, among many other products.  She works there every day from 8:00 until 5:00.  Sometimes her daughter helps her in her work when she is not busy.  She has had her place for more than 15 years, and thanks to this business she has been able to get her daughter ahead.

This loan is to stock her business, to buy costume jewelry, household appliances, and clothing, among other products.

Her dream is that her daughter will be a professional.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry, household appliances, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Leonid

texts.ru:
Леонид с семьей живет в Водяном. Он занимается выращиванием ранних овощей, редиса, огурцов и помидор в теплицах. У Леонида есть большой участок земли, три большие теплицы 60х9 метров и две отдельные теплицы для рассады. Фермерством он занимается уже 8 лет. В хозяйство вложено 100 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку составляют 36 000 гривен ежегодно. 

Леониду необходим кредит КИВА в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пленку на 4 000 гривен, семена на 5 000 гривен и удобрения на 1 000 гривен. Полученные заемные средства помогут Леониду вовремя натянуть пленку и накрыть теплицы, пока не сильно холодно, чтобы начать сеять семена. Леонид вкладывает полученную прибыль в улучшение жилищных условий в собственном доме – недавно они сделали хороший ремонт, смогли сделать ванну и туалет в доме. Осенью Леонид планирует провести хорошее отопление в доме, для чего ему понадобятся дополнительные средства.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Leonid and his family live in Vodyanoye.  He grows early vegetables, radishes, cucumbers, and tomatoes in greenhouses.  Leonid has a large piece of land, three large greenhouses (60 x 9 meters) and two separate greenhouses for seedlings.  He has been farming for eight years.  There are 100,000 hryven (UAH) invested in his farm.  Every year the cost of seed and greenhouse film comes to 36,000 hryven. 

Leonid needs a loan through Kiva of 10,000 hryven to buy 4,000 hryven worth of greenhouse film, 5,000 hryven worth of seed, and 1,000 hryven worth of fertilizer.  The borrowed funds will help Leonid to cover and tighten the film on his greenhouses, while it still isn't very cold, so he can begin to sow seed.  Leonid will invest the profit he earns in improving the living conditions in his home.   Not long ago, they finished a good renovation of their house and were able to install a bath and toilet.  This autumn, Leonid is planning to install good heating in the house which is why he will need to have the additional income.

Note: story in Russian

loans.use: to buy 4,000 hryven worth of greenhouse film, 5,000 hryven worth of seed, and 1,000 hryven worth of fertilizer

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is the mother of seven children with the two youngest still of school age. She says she has been taking care of her family with her farming income for the last nine years. Her farm currently produce milk and eggs that she sells in the local market. As with other farmers, she concurs that animal diseases remain the major challenge in farming.

Hellen has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her dairy income and ease her burden in providing for the family’s basic needs. She hopes to increase the number of her cows to four.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yrene

texts.en:
Yrene belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha.” The bank is located in Pisac, a district of Calca province in the Cusco department. Yrene is 33 years old and has one child with her partner. In order to support her family, Yrene sells artisan products in the local arts and crafts market, primarily to tourists who are visiting nearby Macchu Picchu. Popular keepsakes include colorful hand-woven textiles and an assortment of winter knits made from alpaca fleece.

Yrene is requesting a loan in order to purchase handicrafts for her stand, which will allow her to offer a better selection to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts for a souvenir stand.

loans.name: Pura Soveida

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Pura, tiene 57 años de edad, está separada de su esposo pero de esta relación tienen tres hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
 
Para salir adelante ella se dedica al comercio, para lo cual instala un pequeño local en una de las vías del cantón donde les permiten a otros comerciantes vender sus productos, allí ella también vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, zapatillas y todo tipo de bisutería, trabaja todos los días desde hace mas de 24 años y gracias a su negocio pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos sola ya que se  separo hace muchos años y desde allí tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos. 

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y bisutería y así surtir aun más su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Esfuerzo y Poder Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Olmedo Canton in the province of Manabí. This place is known for its pretty landscapes and its hardworking people, who work in agriculture and raising animals.

Here we met Pura.  She is 57 years old and separated from her husband, but from this relationship they have three children who are already adults and independent.

To get ahead she works in sales, for which she sets up a little place on one of the thoroughfares in the canton, where they allow other vendors to sell their products.  There she also sells all types of clothing, shoes, sneakers, and all types of costume jewelry.  She has worked every day for more than 24 years and thanks to her business she managed to get her children ahead, because she was separated many years ago and, since then, she had to take charge of her children.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry and so stock her business even more.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot.

Her dreams are to have good health and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Moria

texts.en:
Moria is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 1 year and 7 years; two of them go to school. 

Moria runs a roofing-poles business; he has been in the business for six years. He has one employee. Moria heard about Finance Sudan through outreach and promotion done in the market by the officer. He is taking a loan of 3,500 Sudan pounds to purchase more roofing poles. In additions to this business, Moria has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Moria would like to hope for incremental increases in the business size and also to have a better house. 

His major challenges include his low income rate and feeding issues only.

Moria says a lot of thanks for giving Finance Sudan support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more roofing poles.

loans.name: Los Excelentes 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group Los Excelentes 1 & 2, which is composed of 10 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is a rural area outside of the city. 

Francisca sells underwear. She and the other members are doing business in their community and the nearest ones by walking.

Francisca is a hardworking mother with four children. Her most important challenges are to work hard to provide for her family and to help her long-term partner with extra income. 

She is receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza Internacional and she is committed to working harder to improve her business. Francisca would like to save her profits to reinvest in her business. She wants to be a wholesaler and sell to other sellers. The 10 members of the group are shown in the two pictures taken in their community.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 1 Group

texts.en:
Maura is one of the members of 'Minerva Mirabal group 1' (named after one of the legendary Mirabal sisters who resisted and were killed by the dictator Trujillo). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. These five women are dedicated to working hard and developing their business to bring changes to their families. 

She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. Maura is excited to be taking out her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She runs a business selling bacon and sausage and this loan is to invest in purchasing pork and beef to prepare salted meat and pork sausage. She will use the profits to cover her home expenses and to reinvest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy pork and beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 45 years old, single, and runs multiple businesses. In the photo, Doris is pictured in her shop where she sells artisanal handicrafts and souvenirs. Doris also runs a restaurant, where passersby can count on her assortment of snacks and beverages to satisfy their cravings.

Doris belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha.” The bank is located in Pisac, a city within Calca province in the Cusco district. Doris is requesting a 1000 PEN loan in order to buy food and beverages for her restaurant. The loan will help Doris maintain the necessary inventory in order to sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en: Maria Rosa is 40 years old, married and lives with her family in Quito, Ecuador.  Always the hard worker, Maria Rosa began raising hamsters, something her mother taught her, about a year ago in order to help her family make ends meet. After doing this for a while, she decided to try for a loan for the first time in order to buy some pigs, something she hopes will increase her income significantly.  Her dream is to eventually own enough pigs to have a full-fledged pig farm, something that can help secure a good life for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Nzambi

texts.en:
Nzambi is an enterprising 54 year old businesswoman.  She is married to Peter, a farmer, and is blessed with nine children.  She has been selling ropes for the past six years, and earns a monthly income of KES 2,300, which she uses to support her family.

Nzambi is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy more sisal for making ropes. The profits will be used to educate her children. She dreams of opening a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more sisal for making ropes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 30 year old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. She is single. Her business has been in operation for the past three years and it is doing great. 

This is her first business loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and washing detergent. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and washing detergent

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama lives near Elmina, Ghana in the town of Eguafo. She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. Ama has been a fish monger for four years now; she also sells kenkey. Ama uses her income to help pay her family’s utility bills.

Ama will use her loan of 600 GHS from CRAN to purchase fish to fry for sale and bags of maize to prepare her kenkey to sell. With increased profits Ama wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and bags of maize.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 35 year old lady from Homabay town, in western Kenya.  She is married to Geofrey, and they have children aged six, nine and twelve years.

Caroline operates a cosmetics shop, a business she has been running for the last 10 years and which earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stock of hair products and other beauty products. Her profits will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and other beauty products.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Juliana is 49 years old.  She is married to Jonathan, and the couple are blessed with three children aged 25, 13 and 9 years respectively. She owns a grocery store, a business she started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase products requested by her customers, such as fruit, vegetables and maize. The profit she earns from the loan will help her to start dairy farming. Her hope is to improve her standard of living. This is her fifth loan.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, vegetables, and maize for sale.

loans.name: Maria Imakulata

texts.en:
Maria is a single 19-year-old woman who owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Maria needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome to help her crops grow.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to continue to improve her growing operation.

In 2012, Maria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Maria's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers to help her grow vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is 37 years old. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand it further in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy 3 sacks of maize, beans and rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize, beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old, and is married to Kariuki.  She has been a mixed crop farmer for the last ten years, and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her family.

Nancy is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. The anticipated profits will be used to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture in to pig rearing, which will help her improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Foisaga

texts.en:
Foisaga is a 35-year-old woman who is married with two children, ages 2 and 5. She owns & operates a general store, where she sells a variety of goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience with this business.  Foisaga needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to increase her inventory.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 500 talas per week) to continue to expand the store.

In 2012, Foisaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Foisaga's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to build up the inventory in her general store

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg is 48 years old and lives with her three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt/ nomadic tent) in Western Mongolia. Her older kid is employed and the younger two are college students. She operates a meat trading business. She started her business in 1995 with her late husband. Since her husband died, she has been handling the business on her own. Over the years she gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, she needs additional supplies in order to meet the demand. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my two kids are in college, I need to work even harder". She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 62 years old, married, and has 2 children. He sells sweaters, blouses and skirts to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 10 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business.  He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more sweaters, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, blouses and skirts to sell

loans.name: Ath

texts.en:
Ath is a 47-year-old married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has been blessed with 6 children: 3 are married and 3 are single. Ath presently works as a local farmer. She cultivates her rice crops with a plentiful of harvest in both rainy season and dry season every year because there is a main source of water from the nearby river. 

She is now asking for some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy cashew nuts in bulk from a local plantation to stock for future sale. She hopes that she will be able to make a good profit from her investment. For her prospect, she wants to expand her business and ensure a comfortable living for her children.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk from a local plantation to stock for future sale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a 43-year-old married woman who generates her livelihood from an agricultural business. She has become a single mother of five children, two of whom have already started their own families and live separately around Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. To help the family out of poverty, one of her sons has been operating a materials recycling business among the whole commune. He goes through the village to collect and purchase the materials from local people and then he sells them to the recycling industry for profit.

Chea wants to borrow a loan of $1,200 to keep as sufficient capital to invest in the materials-recycling business. With the helpful funds, her son will be able to purchase as many materials as he can and thereby increase their daily income. In the future, Chea wants to become the owner of a medium-size recycling industry in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to have capital for the purchase of recycled materials.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel de 48 años de edad, está casado con Rebeca de 46 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 7 hijos. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Él es agricultor dedicado al cultivo de cacao y café que junto a su querida esposa trabajan duro para obtener una buena producción. Sus puntos de venta los realiza en el distrito de Llochegua a los grandes acopiadores quienes le pagan un buen precio por sus productos. Asimismo nos comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la albañilería, y con las ganancias que percibian logró comprar su terreno agrícola donde ahora cultiva café y cacao, por tal motivo es que está contento. Israel en un futuro esta pensando abrir un restaurante en el distrito de Llochegua con la finalidad de tener mejores ingresos y a la vez sus hijos menores puedan estudiar en un mejor colegio. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que él una vez mas se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Está contento con su banco comunal por que son alegres y trabajadores. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de sus parcelas de cacao y café, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Israel, 48, is married to Rebeca, 46.  They have seven children from this relationship.  Together they live in the community of Periavente Alta in the district of Llochegua.  He is a farmer who grows cacao and coffee with his beloved wife.  They work hard to get a good production.

He makes his sales in the district of Llochegua to the big buyers who pay him a good price for his products.  He also tells us that before he used to work in bricklaying, and with the profits he made he managed to buy his plot of farmland where now he grows coffee and cacao.  This is why he is happy.

Israel is planning to open a restaurant in the future, in the district of Llochegua, with the goal of having better income and, at the same time, for his younger children to be able to study in a better school.

This will be his second loan with MFP, for which he once again promises to make his payments punctually.  He is happy with his communal bank because they are happy and hardworking.

With the 3,000 PEN he will do the maintenance on his cacao and coffee plots, for which he will hire farmworkers.

loans.use: to hire farmworkers.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda is a 44-year-old single woman who has two children, ages 6 and 16. She describes herself as a patient and hardworking woman who began planting and harvesting grenadinas (an orange, seeded fruit with a pulpy interior) about six years ago in order to make a living for herself and her kids. Although it is very hard work, Amanda is happy to do this job, for it is how she is able to pay for her children's education. With this loan she hopes to build a greenhouse so that her grenadinas can last through the rainy season. Her dream for the future is to see her kids graduate college and to see that her hard work paid off.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse for her grenadinas (an orange, seeded fruit with a pulpy interior).

loans.name: Taumaloto

texts.en:
Taumaloto is 52 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small lawn-mowing business in which she cuts grass for people in her community.  She has one year of experience with this business.  

Taumaloto needs a loan of 1,000 talas to purchase supplies to keep mowing lawns. She plans to use her profits (estimated to be 400 talas per week) to continuing improving her new business.

In 2012, Taumaloto joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Taumaloto's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her lawn-mowing business.

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Chab, age 30, is in two businesses at the same time. She is a local rice farmer and is a fresh-fish vendor from a local market in Baray district. Her husband is very supportive to help her in each business. This couple has tried hard because they want to ensure a better living and provide a further education to their two school-age children.

Chab would like to acquire these funds to pay for the process of cultivating dry-season rice. She hopes to produce a good harvest through using the loan from HKL and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the process of cultivating dry-season rice.

loans.name: Missebo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSEBO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontines. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Joséphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Joséphine est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Joséphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Joséphine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Jean. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Joséphine vend depuis une vingtaine d’année de l’huile de palme qu'elle produit et des vins de palme dans une région du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Joséphine vend divers articles (plastiques, gasoil). Joséphine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Joséphine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSEBO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
